title: How to write Greek in cursive - Quora

response.answer_text: Aloha, They don’t. At least not since the ‘50s. You could just find a natural way to connect the letters or use the Cyrillic Alphabet as a model for it. Disclaimer: I don’t speak Greek. I don’t try to speak Greek. I only use it for higher maths and sciences. So to me, pi is always 3.14. LOL. I do know the Russian alphabet. I use that instead. No one can read it in Greek but oh well. It’s easier for me. Aloha.
